com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.archetypes: Discard all cards attached to this card and put it on the bottom of your deck.
com.direwolfdigital.cake.rules.abilities: Discard all basic Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each card you discarded in this way. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Discard a card from your hand. If you can't discard a card, this attack does nothing.
Discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.
This attack does 10 damage for each Pokémon Tool card in your discard pile.
This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on that Pokémon. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.
If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.
Discard up to 2 cards from your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.
During your next turn, the Defending Pokémon takes 60 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

For the rest of this game, your Pokémon’s attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent’s Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra {W} Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), when your opponent’s Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from those attacks, take 1 more Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
This attack does 50 more damage for each Unidentified Fossil card in your discard pile.
This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
This Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.
Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. If your opponent has exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, put 12 damage counters on them instead.
If you have any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage.
Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra {W} Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 150 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
You may attach up to 3 {W} Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like. If you do, heal 50 damage from those Pokémon for each card you attached to them in this way.
The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.
You may search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned and Confused. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand. If you do, you may play Lillie's Poké Doll from your hand as your new Active Pokémon.
During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 40 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.
Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon, except {*} (Prism Star) Pokémon, in the Lost Zone.
If this Pokémon has any {W} Energy attached to it, this attack does 80 more damage.
Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.
This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, put 10 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.
If this Pokémon has 2 or more different types of basic Energy attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.
Shuffle a card from your discard pile into your deck.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.
Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.
Choose an attack from 1 of this Pokémon's previous Evolutions and use it as this attack.
If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 120 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.
This attack’s damage isn’t affected by any effects on your opponent’s Active Pokémon. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

This card provides {C} Energy. \n\nWhen you attach this card from your hand to a Pokémon, draw a card.

When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

If you have Lunala in play, your Solgaleo and Lunala take 50 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Armor of the Sunne Ability at a time.
This Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon for each Prize card you have taken (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Solgaleo in play, you may search your deck for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to your Solgaleo or Lunala in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top card of your opponent's deck.
Once during your turn, when you discard this Pokémon with the effect of Roxie, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Place damage counters after the effect of Roxie.)
If your opponent has any Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX in play, this Pokémon's attacks cost {C}{C}{C} less.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a card, shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of it.

Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for up to 3 Supporter cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. If you searched your deck in this way, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.
As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, your Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is {C}{C} less.

Once during your turn (before your attack), if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may draw 3 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dance of Tribute Ability each turn.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.
As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is {P} and {F} type.
As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, all of your Pokémon take 30 less damage from your opponent’s attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 8 cards of your deck and attach any number of basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
If your opponent’s Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, this Pokémon can evolve during the turn you play it.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a {R} Energy card from your hand. If you do, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may choose 2 random cards from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals those cards and shuffles them into their deck.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.
If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put 4 damage counters on your opponent’s Pokémon in any way you like.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokémon. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.
Whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

The attacks of your Pokémon-GX in play that evolve from Eevee do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Power Cheer Ability at a time.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put the top card of your opponent's deck on the bottom of their deck without looking at it.
At the end of your opponent's turn, if this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, flip a coin. If tails, shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card.
Pokémon-GX that have any damage counters on them (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.
Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, when you attach a {G} Energy card from your hand to it, you may switch 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Asleep. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's TAG TEAM Pokémon and Ultra Beasts, and by your opponent's Pokémon that have any Special Energy attached to them.
As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
The attacks of your Pokémon-GX in play that evolve from Eevee cost {C} less. You can't apply more than 1 Speed Cheer Ability at a time.

Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 3 cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.
Your opponent's Pokémon that are affected by Special Conditions can't retreat.
This Pokémon can't attack unless your opponent has 2 or fewer Prize cards remaining.
Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Pokémon from your hand. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.
Your Pokémon-GX in play that evolve from Eevee get +60 HP. You can't apply more than 1 Vitality Cheer Ability at a time.

Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon. If you do, discard all cards attached to this Pokémon and put it on the bottom of your deck.
The attacks of the Ultra Beast this card is attached to do 10 more damage to your opponent’s Active Pokémon for each Prize card you have taken (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

Discard 3 cards from the top of each player’s deck.\n\nWhen you play this card, you may discard 3 other cards from your hand. If you do, each player discards their Benched Pokémon until they have 3 Benched Pokémon. Your opponent discards first.
Whenever either player plays a Stadium card from their hand, discard that Stadium card after discarding this one. (The new Stadium card has no effect.)
Discard the top 7 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Item cards, put them into your hand.

Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand. You can't choose Cynthia & Caitlin or a card you discarded with the effect of this card.\n\nWhen you play this card, you may discard another card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

If the Pokémon this card is attached to has the Dragon Claw attack, it can use the GX attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.)

{C}{C}{C} Destructive Drake GX 80×
Discard all basic Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each card you discarded in this way. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Each player may draw up to 3 cards. You draw first.

Once during each player’s turn, that player may discard a card from their hand. If they do, that player searches their deck for up to 2 {R} Energy cards, reveals them, and puts them into their hand. Then, that player shuffles their deck.
You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.\n\nSwitch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX with their Active Pokémon.

Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.\n\nWhen you play this card, you may discard 2 other cards from your hand. If you do, you may also search for a Pokémon Tool card and a Special Energy card in this way.
The Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX this card is attached to gets -100 HP, and when it is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent’s attack, that player takes 1 fewer Prize card.
Shuffle a Pokémon and a Pokémon Tool card from your discard pile into your deck.
Draw 4 cards.\n\nAt the end of this turn, if you have 3 or more cards in your hand, shuffle cards from your hand into your deck until you have 2 cards in your hand.

Play this card as if it were a 30-HP {C} Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may discard all cards from it and put it on the bottom of your deck.\n\nThis card can't retreat. If this card is Knocked Out, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.

Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. \n\nWhen you play this card, you may discard 2 other cards from your hand. If you do, heal 120 damage from the Pokémon you moved to your Bench.

The attacks of non-Ultra Beast Pokémon that have any basic {F} Energy attached to them (both yours and your opponent's) do 10 more damage to the opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If the attacking player has more Prize cards remaining than their opponent, those attacks do 40 more damage instead.

Search your deck for up to 3 {W} Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.\n\nWhen you play this card, you may discard 5 other cards from your hand. If you do, during this turn, your {W} Pokémon can use their GX attacks even if you have used your GX attack.
Discard the top 6 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are basic Energy cards, attach them to 1 of your Benched {N} Pokémon.
Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.
Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon of different types and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

Search your deck for a Pokémon-GX that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.)\n\nWhen you play this card, you may discard 2 other cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to the Pokémon you evolved in this way.
Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards. If you discarded an Energy card in this way, draw 2 more cards.

You can play this card only if 1 of your Pokémon was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn.\n\nSearch your deck for a Pokémon, a Trainer card, and a basic Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Discard up to 2 Pokémon that aren't Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX from your hand. Draw 3 cards for each card you discarded in this way.
Search your deck for up to 2 TAG TEAM cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Play this card as if it were a 60-HP {C} Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may discard this card from play.\n\nThis card can't retreat.
The next time you flip any number of coins for the effect of an attack, Ability, or Trainer card this turn, choose heads or tails for the first coin flip.
customchoice.drawcards: Would you like to draw up to {0} cards?
customchoice.drawncards: Would you like to draw until you have {0} cards in your hand?
customchoice.lookatncardsondeck: Would you like to look at the top {0} cards of your deck?
customchoice.sm12_144.dollswap: Would you like to play Lillie's Poké Doll from your hand as your new Active Pokémon?
customchoice.sm12_151.flowerpicking: Would you like to shuffle a random card from your opponent's hand into their deck?
customchoice.sm12_152.flowerpicking: Would you like to shuffle 2 random cards from your opponent's hand into their deck?
customchoice.sm12_186.bellelbabrycenman: Would you like to discard 3 cards from your hand to make each player discard Benched Pokémon until they have 3 remaining?
customchoice.sm12_186.button1: Discard 3 cards from the top of each player’s deck.
customchoice.sm12_186.button2: Discard 3 cards from the top of each player’s deck, and discard 3 other cards from your hand to make each player discard Benched Pokémon until they have 3 Benched Pokémon.
customchoice.sm12_189.button1: Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.
customchoice.sm12_189.button2: Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand, and discard another card from your hand to draw 3 cards.
customchoice.sm12_189.cynthiacaitlin: Would you like to discard a card from your hand to draw 3 cards?
customchoice.sm12_191.erika: How many cards would you like to draw?
customchoice.sm12_193.button1: Search your deck for a Stadium card to put into your hand.
customchoice.sm12_193.button2: Search your deck for a Stadium card to put into your hand, and discard 2 other cards from your hand to also search your deck for a Pokémon Tool card and a Special Energy card.
customchoice.sm12_193.guzmahala: Would you like to discard 2 cards from your hand to also search for a Pokémon Tool card and a Special Energy card?
customchoice.sm12_198.button1: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
customchoice.sm12_198.button2: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, and discard 2 other cards from your hand to heal 120 damage from the Pokémon you moved to your Bench.
customchoice.sm12_198.mallowlana: Would you like to discard 2 cards to heal 120 damage from the Pokémon you move to your Bench?
customchoice.sm12_199.button1: Search your deck for 3 {W} Energy cards to put into your hand.
customchoice.sm12_199.button2: Search your deck for 3 {W} Energy cards to put into your hand, and discard 5 other cards from your hand to allow your {W} Pokémon to use their GX attacks this turn even if you have used your GX attack.
customchoice.sm12_199.mistylorelei: Would you like to discard 5 cards from your hand to allow your {W} Pokémon to use their GX attacks this turn?
customchoice.sm12_202.button1: Search your deck for a Pokémon-GX.
customchoice.sm12_202.button2: Search your deck for a Pokémon-GX, and discard 2 other cards to search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards.
customchoice.sm12_202.redblue: Would you like to discard 2 cards from your hand to also search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards to attach to the newly evolved Pokémon?
customchoice.sm12_208.will: Choose the result of this coin flip.

playmat.prompt.sm12_167.followmytail: Choose any number of Eevee and Eevee-GX to put onto your Bench.

playmat.prompt.sm12_195.lanasfishingrod: Choose a Pokémon and a Pokémon Tool card to shuffle into your deck.

specialvisualization.sm12_75.lightofthep: All effects of the opponent's attacks, including damage, done to this player's Pokémon are prevented.
specialvisualizations.canevolvethisturn: This Pokémon can evolve this turn.
specialvisualizations.sm12_11.swayingstr: This player's Pokémon that are affected by Special Conditions can't retreat.
specialvisualizations.sm12_129.smugface: This Pokémon is immune to all effects of attacks, including damage, from opposing TAG TEAM Pokémon and Ultra Beasts, and from Pokémon with Special Energy attached to them.
specialvisualizations.sm12_142.armorofth: This player's Solgaleo and Lunala take less damage from the opponent's attacks.
specialvisualizations.sm12_156.alteredcr: This player takes 1 more Prize card when damage from 1 of their attacks Knocks Out their opponent's Active Pokémon.
specialvisualizations.sm12_199.mistylore: This player's {W} Pokémon can use their GX attacks this turn.
specialvisualizations.sm12_208.will: This player can choose the result of their first coin flip for the effect of an attack, Ability, or Trainer card.
specialvisualizations.sm12_25.powercheer: This player's Pokémon-GX that evolve from Eevee do 30 more damage to the oppposing Active Pokémon.
specialvisualizations.sm12_42.vitalitych: This player's Pokémon-GX that evolve from Eevee get +60 HP.
specialvisualizations.sm12_70.speedcheer: Attacks of this player's Pokémon-GX that evolve from Eevee cost {C} less.
specialvisualizations.sm12_8.solarpower: This player ignores all Energy in the attack costs of {G} Pokémon and {R} Pokémon.
specialvisualizations.sm12_92.poisoncult: This player's Active Pokémon takes more damage from being Poisoned.
specialvisualizations.sm12_97.shadowbox: This player's Pokémon-GX that have any damage counters on them have no Abilities.
